course.subject: FINA
course.name: Bloomberg Market Concepts Certification
course.description: The course aims to provide students with knowledge of financial markets and Bloomberg functionality. The course consists of four modules: economic indicators, currencies, fixed income and equities. Students will need to complete all four modules to receive the Bloomberg Market Concepts certification. Graded P or F. For students with major in FINA and QFIN only.

reviews.author: Arange
reviews.comment_content: This is a self-learning course at library. There are four modules: Economic Indicators, Currencies, Fixed Income and Equities. The videos provided by Bloomberg will teach you the basic finance market concepts and how you can find the financial data using Bloomberg terminal
reviews.comment_teaching: No teaching by instructor. You only need to play the videos and you can finish the course.
reviews.comment_grading:
Pass or Fail.
Questions are popped out when you playing the video. You need to answer the question.
If you complete the bloomberg market concept module and get half of the questions correct, pass. Otherwise, fail.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light, you only need to stay at the library for about 4 to 5 hours, and you can complete all the modules in one day.

reviews.author: Shawnnn
reviews.title: Quite Decent Course
reviews.comment_content:
Register a Bloomberg Account and learn things by yourself thorough Bloomberg Market Concepts.
Nothing is taught by the professors and all the materials are online, including teaching videos and in-class quizzes.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is quite good. The guys in the videos are from Bloomberg anyway.
reviews.comment_grading:
In the Syllabus there are assignments that must be done thorough Bloomberg Machine, like sending an email after login into the account. But due to the situation and instability, all these things were cut.
Since it's a 0 credit  P/F course, all you need is to achieve above 70% in all sections.
reviews.comment_workload: Quite light workload. Approximately you need 10 hours to watch videos and take the quizzes. Not hard if you watch the videos carefully and go thorough all the materials.
